intro: Eriocapitella tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly head plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly hairs on its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer months. Eriocapitella tomentosa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
